teams.name: Mechanical team
teams.description: The "mech" team is responsible for designing and building all of the unmanned vehicles. This team employs their creativity to design them and their hands to construct them.

subteams.name: UGV Team
subteams.description: The UGV team designs and builds the Unmanned Ground Vehicle (UGV) and all related mechanisms for the competition. After the vehicle is dropped from the main plane mid-flight, it has to land safely and carry out tasks.

subteams.name: Plane Team
subteams.description: The Plane team designs and builds the main UAV for the AUVSI SUAS competition.

subteams.name: Testing Plane Team
subteams.description: The Testing Plane team designs and builds a smaller, less complex UAV that the programming team can use for testing before deploying any programs to the main UAV. The testing plane can also be used to collect flight footage (before the main UAV is ready) for the Computer Vision team to use.

teams.name: Programming team
teams.description: The programming team sets up the autopilot software and utilizes cutting-edge algorithms to implement all programming related aspects of the competition.

subteams.name: GCS Team
subteams.description: The Ground Control Station (GCS) Team programs the flight computer onboard the main UAV and sets up the comms technology that allows the plane to receive instructions and send back telemetry and other data to the groundstation.

subteams.name: CV Team
subteams.description: The Computer Vision (CV) Team implements all computer vision related tasks for the competition such as obstacle avoidance, image stitching, and object detection.

teams.name: Electronics team
teams.description: This team sets up all of the electronics for the plane. However, there are no members dedicated solely to the electronics team since the work is generally split between the Mech and Programming team which select the electronics that best suit their needs.
